Disorientation takes them by surprise as they have to navigate Salar de Uyuni - a salt lake so vast that Buzz Aldrin could see it from space. Their goal is the ancient mountain city of Potosi, whose silver mines financed the Spanish empire in the 16th century and which is almost 5,000 metres above sea level.

programme.title: The World at War

programme.title: Fleetwood Mac - Don't Stop
programme.desc: Documentary looking back over the band's long career, from the early blues outfit led by Peter Green in the late 1960s, to their reincarnation in the 1970s with the line-up that went on to record the 40-million-selling album Rumours. Mick Fleetwood, John McVie, Lindsey Buckingham and Stevie Nicks reveal the truth behind the successes, failures and relationships that characterised their music and made them one of the most enduring acts in popular music.

programme.title: Meat Loaf: In and Out of Hell
programme.desc: A profile of the rock star's life and career, reflecting on the music that propelled him to fame and charting his journey from an overweight, bullied child to his larger-than-life persona and icon status. Featuring an interview and performance by the singer, as well as backstage footage from a Las Vegas concert. The film also revisits the Dallas of Meat Loaf's early years and includes insights from high school friends who reveal where the unusual moniker really came from.

programme.title: The Rolling Stones at the BBC
programme.desc: A selection of the band's performances from the BBC archives, in a programme originally broadcast in 2012 to celebrate their 50th anniversary. Songs include The Last Time, Let's Spend The Night Together, Get Off of My Cloud, Honky Tonk Women, Gimme Shelter, Miss You and Start Me Up. Plus, footage of the band performing 19th Nervous Breakdown on Top of the Pops in 1966, which was used in a 1960s BBC documentary about women with depression.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The story of the Nazi quest to establish an Aryan race, which set out to subjugate the Jewish population with decrees and laws about citizenship and escalated to the use of execution camps and the horrors of the Holocaust. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.sub-title: To the Ends of the Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough travels to the Arctic and Antarctic to explore the wildernesses at Earth's poles, investigating the wildlife and geographical features found there. He begins by travelling to the North Pole, where two polar bears reveal a surprisingly tender side to their characters, before heading to the South Pole - 100 years after Roald Amundsen and Robert Falcon Scott first reached it.

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: A polar bear hunts with her cubs, while the warmer weather of spring accelerates a process that will eventually see an area of ice the size of Australia disappear into the Arctic Ocean. A woolly bear caterpillar emerges from the snow after spending the winter frozen, and in Antarctica male Adelie penguins arrive to begin constructing nests in fierce storms as they try to attract mates.

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: How animals in the polar regions adapt to the summer weather. In a colony of 400,000 king penguins the adults go surfing and the chicks take mud-baths to cool off, while polar bear cubs take their first swimming lessons as the ice they inhabit melts away. A minke whale is hunted by a family of killer whales, succumbing to their battering after two hours, and Adelie penguins try to prevent their chicks being snatched by skuas.

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: With the arrival of autumn the Arctic Ocean begins freezing over, and polar bears gather in large numbers on the coast as they await the return of the ice. Two thousand beluga whales head for a particular estuary to thrash against the gravel and exfoliate, while in Antarctica, Adelie penguins take to the sea for the first time and face the danger of leopard seal attacks.

programme.title: Big in America: British Hits in the USA
programme.desc: Compilation of British rock 'n' roll acts in performance, featuring songs that crossed over to the US charts. From the Dave Clark Five to Coldplay, the Brits have rocked America and sometimes even done better across the pond than on home soil. A Flock of Seagulls, Supertramp and Bush also feature, alongside darker British global exports like Black Sabbath and the Cure.

programme.title: Duran Duran: There's Something You Should Know
programme.desc: Simon Le Bon, John Taylor, Nick Rhodes and Roger Taylor open up about the highs and lows of the band's career - with archive footage of former guitarist Andy Taylor helping round out the story. The documentary charts their trajectory through seven of their 14 albums, each one uncovering a compelling chapter in the history of five lads from Birmingham who had one simple dream - to become the biggest band in the world. Contributors include Boy George, Nile Rodgers and Mark Ronson.

programme.title: You've Got a Friend: The Carole King Story
programme.desc: The award-winning US singer gives an account of her life, looking back on her upbringing in Brooklyn, and the subsequent success she enjoyed as part of husband-and-wife songwriting team Goffin and King in the 1960s, including the creation of global hits Take Good Care of My Baby, The Locomotion and Will You Love Me Tomorrow. By 1970, Carole was divorced and had moved to Los Angeles, where she created her classic solo album Tapestry. Now in her seventies, she reveals herself to be as much an environmental activist as a musician, lobbying Congress in defence of the wildlife and eco-systems in her beloved Idaho.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines how fleas are able to jump great distances for their size and attempts to discover how fast a cheetah can run.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores animals that have developed tool-making skills to help them survive, including orangutans and crows.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines animals that are able to expand their bodies, including anacondas and camels.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough reveals the unusual ways in which flamingoes and blue whales eat, examining the ways feeding patterns have influenced both species' behaviour in similar ways.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: The surprising preventive and curative 'medicine' developed by certain species, including the hippopotamus, which secretes a red slime to act as a highly efficient sun screen.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: Two families with remarkable powers of regenerating unusually large body parts easily - salamanders, which do so when a large chunk, such as the tail or a limb, has been bitten off by a predator, and male moose, which grow and shed antlers every year.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough reveals why male seahorses give birth, and looks at how hyena packs are dominated by the female members.

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive footage of guitarists taken from BBC music shows of the 1970s. Includes electric performances by Carlos Santana, Mark Knopfler, Peter Green and the Edge, and acoustic material by John Martyn, John Renbourn, Bert Jansch and Paco Pena.

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: A celebration of 1970s-era axe-men, acoustic virtuosos and thumping riff merchants, in a compilation of guitar-heavy performances from the BBC TV archives. Guitar gods including Jimi Hendrix, Pete Townshend, Peter Green and Johnny Winter are joined by, among others, flamenco maestro Manitas De Plata, bottleneck bluesman Ry Cooder and straight-up rockers AC/DC and Thin Lizzy. Plus, Fleetwood Mac, the Jam and Be Bop Deluxe and Nils Lofgren.

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: Status Quo play Pictures of Matchstick Men on Top of the Pops in 1968, the Who perform Long Live Rock in the Old Grey Whistle Test studio, Dire Straits deliver Tunnel of Love and Lynyrd Skynyrd bring a taste of the American South with Sweet Home Alabama. The programme also features rare performances from George Benson, Leo Kottke, Link Wray and Tom Petty.

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive footage from BBC music shows of the 1970s. Including electric performances by the Rolling Stones, Eric Clapton, David Bowie, Motorhead, Nazareth, AC/DC and George Thorogood, as well as acoustic material by Michael Chapman, Horslips and Paco de Lucia.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Expert hauliers Eric Harrison and Chris Case move an iconic Deltic diesel, better known as The Royal Highland Fusilier, halfway across the country to the Telford Steam Fair.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Zak and Alex face a four-day mission to deliver a pair of classic steam locomotives for an Autumn Steam Gala at the Mid Hants Railway in Hampshire.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Heavy haulage experts Ian Bagladi and Jamie Turnbull need to move a classical but abandoned 63-year-old, 70-tonne locomotive, through the English countryside.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Kevin Norris and Kieran Chisnall move three state-of-the-art trains, fresh in from Japan. They need to transport them from the North East port of Redcar to a factory in Doncaster.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: WW2 Price of Empire
programme.desc: How the Allies came closer to victory in 1944, as Russian forces made advances on the Eastern Front and the US recaptured the Philippines.

programme.title: WW2 Price of Empire
programme.desc: Archive pictures and eyewitness testimony reveal how the Allies finally achieved victory, following a series of successes in Europe and the Far East.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: The history of the concentration camp, charting its origins as a place to hold political prisoners through its development into a mechanised factory for mass murder. The first episode features the accounts of Polish inmates held there prior to the Holocaust, Jewish survivors and a former SS officer, who discusses being placed in charge of a firing squad.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: A look at the early stages of genocide at the camp, examining the role of commander Rudolf Hoess in the process. Despite later claiming he was only following orders, Hoess was instrumental in the development of Auschwitz for mass murder, arranging for Soviet prisoners to be brought in as construction workers and scouring Europe for more victims to kill. Featuring contributions from survivors.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: Examining the complex system the Nazis set up to implement the extermination of the Jewish race throughout Europe from 1942, with Auschwitz as the hub. The programme reveals that at other camps, including Treblinka, Belzec and Sobibor, rival commanders participated in the genocide with enthusiasm and shared ideas for the best method of mass murder.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough presents an exploration of Earth's vast seas, which cover 70 per cent of the planet's surface. In the first episode, millions of squid appear off the coast of California, gannets, whale sharks and dolphins hunt migrating sardines in the Indian Ocean, and thousands of turtles make the annual pilgrimage to lay their eggs in Costa Rica.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Camera crews journey to the deepest parts of the world's oceans to explore the lives of their inhabitants, including fearsome predators with huge teeth, strange jellyfish and deep-sea sharks that lurk among the gigantic submerged mountains and volcanos. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Predators and prey in the open oceans come under the scrutiny of David Attenborough. Marlin track down a shoal of sardines as a sei whale scoops up the leftovers, dolphins herd mackerel and attract the attention of a sailfish with the resonance of their sonar, and giant sunfish queue up to allow other species, including seagulls, to feed on their parasites.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Marine life at the poles, where winter temperatures frequently fall to a numbing -40C. Even when the sun reappears in the spring, its weak rays take a long time to melt the ice. David Attenborough describes how wildlife including seals, whales, polar bears and penguins overcome the elements to survive through prolonged cold spells.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: An underground city beneath a forest in Northern France built to house 3,000 people, an ice cave under Iceland's biggest glacier, and a subterranean power station in London.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A ruined compound on the edge of a peninsula in Colombia which was once home to a famous outlaw and the strange towers looming over red-tinted waters in a Portuguese landscape.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A Cold War Soviet classic goes under the hammer. Built like a tank, the Moskovitch gets few admirers for style, but finds a loving home with a fan of Eastern Bloc classics.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: The crew visits Germany to collect a multi-million-pound maintenance machine so large it will need to be loaded onto two trucks. Eric and Chris oversee a diesel-engine exchange.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Meeting the Welsh Highland Railway's oldest volunteer fireman, 80-year-old Cedric Lodge, who has worked on the railways for 60 years. In Devon, there is a look at the Autotrain.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The sabotaging efforts of Peugeot in Nazi-occupied France, where the bosses and workers cooperated closely with the Resistance to hinder the use of military vehicles by the Nazis.

programme.title: Royals on the Frontline
programme.desc: An unprecedented insight into the Royals and the armed services that fight in their name, from the early 20th century to modern-day conflicts such as Afghanistan. The first episode focuses on Prince Philip and Queen Elizabeth.

programme.title: Royals on the Frontline
programme.desc: Prince Andrew discusses his stint in the Falklands and what it's really like to confront your own mortality, while Prince Edward's decision to quit his marine training is examined.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: WW2 Price of Empire
programme.desc: Reflections on the final days of the Second World War and the surrender of the Axis powers, including how empires fell and the political map of the world was remade.

programme.title: WW2 Price of Empire
programme.desc: History of the conflict, examining its lasting impact on the political powers that were involved, beginning with a look at 1939 and how different countries were drawn into the war.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: A look at how corruption became rife within the SS, with the money stolen from Jews finding its way into the pockets of the camp guards rather than funding the war effort. Many of the SS also enjoyed illicit sexual relationships with female prisoners. Meanwhile, Dr Mengele embarked on a gruesome series of experiments, using children as guinea pigs in his research into genetic inheritance.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: The events of 1944, when the death toll rose substantially. By this point, the Allies were aware of Auschwitz's purpose, and faced a difficult decision over what should be done about it. Plus, the story of the occupation of Hungary, revealing how Adolf Eichmann offered to spare a million Jews in return for certain services.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: The final episode examines the liberation of Auschwitz and other camps by the Soviet Red Army. However, freedom did not mean an end to the prisoners' suffering - many were mistreated by their liberators and thousands died for the want of medical treatment.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: An exploration of the world's most densely inhabited waters, where variations in temperature owing to the year-long cycle of the sun encourage a vast array of marine life, from seals and sharks in the winter, to lobster and salmon in the summer, dolphins in the autumn and the walking handfish in spring. Narrated by David Attenborough.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Veteran naturalist David Attenborough explores the fragile marine ecosystem of the coral reef, where all creatures, including the corals themselves, have to fight for survival. From tiny beginnings, the reef grows and develops over hundreds of years, providing support for innumerable animals - yet one storm can threaten the entire community.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough investigates the opportunities tides create for marine life, showing giant stingrays gliding on currents for a rest, South African sea snails surfing the waves in pursuit of a meal, crabs playing football on a beach, and bottlenose dolphins embarking on a dangerous game of catch. In the oceanic world each turn of the tide can mean life or death for its inhabitants.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Exploring the wealth of marine life that inhabits the ocean's edge, dealing with the dangers of an ever-shifting environment. David Attenborough observes nesting seabirds in east Russia, Patagonian killer whales, Newfoundland caplin fish, walruses, and Brazilian green turtles - which make their annual expedition to an island in the middle of the Atlantic to lay their eggs.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: The underground bases built by the German army during the occupation of Jersey, and a group of more than 20 underground cities in Turkey, one of which dates back to 800BC.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A formerly luxurious and strategic mountain-top villa on the island of Rhodes in the Mediterranean that's been ravaged by acts of revenge by locals since 1955.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek collects a Jaguar Mark 2 and explains why they made such poor getaway cars for 1960s bank robbers. A customer considers a Morris Marina as a Christmas present for his wife.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.desc: Documentary looking at railroads constructed during history's most turbulent periods, now associated with some of mankind's ugliest deeds. Beginning with the Trans-Pyrenees Railway.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Great Central Railway's Scott Manley takes a rainy busman's holiday working as a guard at Bury, while a team of volunteers in Wales try to keep the line clear of overgrown plants.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The story of America's Liberty Ships', which were produced in incredible numbers and became known as the Model T Fords of the ocean.

programme.title: Royals on the Frontline
programme.desc: The highs and lows of Prince Harry and Prince William's roles in the forces, featuring an interview with Harry in which he discusses a planned secret deployment in Afghanistan.

programme.title: WW2 Price of Empire
programme.desc: Reflections on the final days of the Second World War and the surrender of the Axis powers, including how empires fell and the political map of the world was remade.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: Documentary offering an insight into some of the events in the Bible, beginning with the story of the Ten Plagues. In the Old Testament, the Book of Exodus describes the epic battle between the prophet Moses and Pharaoh. Experts offer various various explanations for the 10 plagues of Moses and the mass exodus of the Hebrew slaves out of Egypt, a story that is a cornerstone of the Jewish, Christian, and Muslim faiths.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: Investigating the Turin Shroud, which is a length of linen cloth that some believe bears the image of Jesus. Cameras follow the efforts of a scientist trying to prove whether the cloth truly is Christ's burial robe.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The people responsible for tracking down war criminals who had evaded capture, beginning with the US army task force in charge of locating German scientists.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The story of Hitler's personal secretary Martin Bormann and the efforts to track him down. With insufficient evidence to confirm the Nazi official's death, the International Military Tribunal at Nuremberg tried him in absentia during 1946 and eventually sentenced him to death. Despite extensive efforts, he was never found and was eventually presumed to have died in May 1945.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: How the SAS War Crimes Investigation Team tried to pinpoint the location of Gestapo officers who were wanted for a host of atrocities.

programme.title: Africa
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the vast and diverse continent, aiming to show its landscapes and wildlife as they have never been seen before. He begins in the Kalahari desert, Africa's south-west corner, where clever meerkats are outsmarted by a wily bird's use of mimicry, a solitary rhino is seen to exhibit previously unknown sociable behaviours, terrifying insects prey on baby birds and the rarest fish in the world is filmed for the first time. In the neighbouring Namib desert, which receives almost no rain, the competition for scant resources can be fierce, as proven by a ferocious fight for supremacy between two giraffes.

programme.title: Africa
programme.desc: David Attenborough continues his exploration of the continent in east Africa, which is a haven for life and supports a higher density of large mammals than anywhere else on Earth. From dense forests to snow-capped peaks, steamy swamps to endless savannah, it's also a land of unpredictable extremes, where creatures must adapt to survive. In Tanzania, a tiny lizard risks its life to eat flies from the face of a sleepy lion. The nesting habits of the 4ft shoebill are also captured on camera - the giant bird has two chicks, but due to sibling rivalry only one will survive. On the plains of Amboseli, a baby elephant is near to death in the drought, so its mother leaves the herd to stay with her offspring until the bitter end.

programme.title: Africa
programme.desc: David Attenborough looks at the varied creatures of the Congo rainforest, one of the most competitive habitats on Earth. A sweet-toothed chimpanzee uses a complex array of tools to access honey from a beehive, the elusive picathartes bird feeds unsuspecting frogs to its dinosaur-like chicks and a massive female python reveals her maternal side as she sunbathes to incubate her eggs. Tiny leaf-folding frogs battle it out kung fu style, and as darkness falls the forest elephants gather to face their rivals.

programme.title: Africa
programme.desc: David Attenborough describes some of the wildlife spectacles of southern Africa, starting out in a little-explored rainforest discovered less than a decade ago by scientists who spotted it on satellite maps. There, thousands of butterflies dance for the right to mate, while on a tiny island off Mozambique, green turtles emerge from eggs and begin a hazardous journey to the water - with pied crows and hungry crabs eager to get them. Cameras also capture one of the largest gatherings of great white sharks on the planet as 30 of the predators circle around a dead whale.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: The secrets of the largest subterranean fortress along France's border with Germany, and a look at how a unique precious mineral was discovered in Derbyshire.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A strange-looking town with a supernatural atmosphere, a collection of imposing buildings in southern Australia, and the remains of curious-looking basins emerging from the waves.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: The team is under pressure with a record number of cars to auction, but Derek finds room for one more - a replica AC Cobra. A couple are reunited with their Volvo breakdown truck.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.desc: An exploration of the Harz Mountain Railway in Germany - Europe's longest rail network - which still uses steam locomotives and has a murky, hidden past.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: At the South Devon Railway, Andy Leech and Liz Turner host afternoon tea for 44 passengers. In East Lancashire, volunteer Chandra Law takes on the new role of Stationmaster.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The remarkable story of how Stalin's massive war factories were dismantled and moved east on one and half million railway trucks, to avoid being lost to the Nazis.

King Henry's mother Lady Margaret Beaufort faces the consequences of harbouring a dark secret. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Meryl and Carlito's relationship leaves the Knight family reeling, the tension between Hugh and Penny endangers the new cardiac clinic, and Matt reconnects with a high school crush.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: There are embarrassing results when Penny's personal feelings for Hugh spill over into the workplace, while Charlie and Matt attempt to cope with an unwanted house guest.

programme.desc: Tracey makes an appointment with a Harley Street specialist, hoping to allay her suspicions that she may be pregnant. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson and Lesley Joseph.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Joy plans a party for the girls while the men are on their training exercise at the Army training ground. Meanwhile, Dave Tucker opens up about feeling depressed.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: In the final episode, the fusiliers attend the funeral of Tony Wilton. Elsewhere, Donna decides that it is time to move out.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Will's career hangs in the balance as the disciplinary hearing gets under way, but when he chooses to save a patient's life rather than attend the hearing, Connie is impressed by his devotion to duty and resolves to speak out on his behalf. Mickie decides to train as a doctor, leaving Donna concerned that this will spell the end of their friendship, while Mubbs objects to the new working hours. The hospital holds a charity trolley dash, which helps bring Tricia and Carlos closer together, while the tension between Ric and Jess escalates, leaving them open to blackmail.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Things look grim for Adam as the day of his trial dawns, until Andrea and Neil manage to expose Jerome Taylor's dirty dealings, while investigations into the death of paedophile Malcolm Willard raise the alarming possibility that a serial sniper could be on the loose in Sun Hill. An angry exchange with Shirley adds to Yvonne's woes as she anxiously awaits the results of her HIV tests.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Jack questions the wisdom of Adam's decision to alert the officers to the presence of a serial sniper on the streets of Sun Hill, while undercover journalist Andrea debates whether to cave in to pressure from her editor and deliver a sensationalistic story that could terrify the local population. Steve is unimpressed with Lance's handling of a hostage situation and resorts to extreme measures to express his displeasure.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Sharon has the unpleasant task of telling Pete about the buyer of the Mitchells' flat. Frank is behind with the book-keeping and Arthur has been avoiding Mark as much as possible.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: The strain on the Fowler family is beginning to show - it can't be long before something or someone cracks. Will Pete tell Kathy before she hears the news from someone else?.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Easter approaches in the spring of 1961, and Patsy helps to deliver a baby that is born with severe deformities. Her husband struggles to cope with his daughter's needs, but the sisters rally round to support the family. Trixie teaches a keep fit class which results in a medical emergency, leaving her determined to teach her patients to understand their own bodies.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Barbara treats a pregnant woman whose dockworker husband is struggling to support her as opportunities for work dry up. She is forced into a difficult decision that leaves Barbara facing the biggest test of her career. Nurse Crane meets a kindred spirit when she learns to speak Spanish, and Sister Evangelina helps a woman with breastfeeding, leading to unforeseen consequences.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: A rare disease spreads around Poplar Street, and Patsy and Dr Turner try to trace the outbreak to its source. Suspicion over the identity of the first carrier threatens to divide a previously close-knit family. Sister Winifred is forced to confront her prejudices while treating a patient, and Barbara worries about how Trixie will react when she agrees to go to dinner with Tom.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Sister Julienne is seconded to a maternity ward, and is impressed by how modern technology is being used to help the mothers - but is left with a moral dilemma after assisting on a traumatic birth. A young man from Poplar is delighted to be accepted into university, but his mother is less than happy. His dreams are jeopardised when his girlfriend gets pregnant, a development that puts pressure on the whole family.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Patrick searches for his father, while Stephen aspires to be a celebrity.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The apparent suicide of a troubled student at Upcott Seminary leads Father Brown to believe a murderer is at work, and he tries to persuade Sid to go undercover in an attempt to flush out the killer. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Death in Paradise

When the agent is killed in his flat, Hannay is thrown headlong into adventure, forced to go on the run under suspicion of murder. Fleeing to Scotland, with police and spies on his tail, he teams up with feisty suffragette Victoria Sinclair, and although they fail to hit it off, the couple become increasingly reliant on each other as they race to unmask a traitor and save Great Britain from German invasion. programme.desc: Part one of two. Adaptation of Charles Dickens' story. An orphan boy endures a horrible childhood in the workhouse, but yearns for more. After being sold to a cruel undertaker, he runs away to London - where he joins a group of pickpockets. Timothy Spall heads an all-star cast as Fagin, with support from Tom Hardy, Gregor Fisher, Sarah Lancashire, Sophie Okonedo, Julian Rhind-Tutt and William Miller in the title role.

programme.title: Oliver Twist
programme.desc: Part two of two. Sikes escapes back to London with a badly wounded Oliver, while Mr Bumble declares his love for Mrs Corney - and captivated by the promise of social advancement, she agrees to marry him. Later, Nancy stumbles on a secret meeting, during which she overhears Monks telling Fagin he wants Oliver dead in two days.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo and Clegg are saved from the boredom of a garden fete when they meet a tramp with a peculiar interest in donkeys. Christmas special from 1987.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest encounters a man who intends to solve his father's murder a year earlier with the use of his brand-new invention - a time machine. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Humphrey and Martha's romantic weekend on a remote island is cut short when a fellow hotel guest is stabbed to death in his room in what appears to be an attempted robbery. But since the flower beds outside the window are undisturbed, Humphrey is certain that one of the victim's associates played a part in his death. There's just one problem - since the DI had a direct view of the only staircase leading up to the room, he is the alibi for all the suspects. Meanwhile, JP worries about his marriage and seeks relationship advice from Dwayne.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team re-examines the murder of a junior doctor strangled in 2010. Interviewing her relatives, who are all doctors, staff at her hospital and a surgeon who had been the young woman's tutor, officers hope to identify a lead that was missed during the original investigation. Depressed at the thought of his daughter Holly leaving home for university, Danny finds himself being cheered by his colleagues as they hire a pedibus for a ride through central London. Tamzin Outhwaite and Nicholas Lyndhurst star.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: First episode of the Glasgow-set crime drama. A murderer is on the loose, and one by one, bodies of young women are found strangled in the city. The inquiry is headed by top detective Jim Taggart, a tough local cop who has risen through the ranks and one of the new breed of graduate policemen, Peter Livingstone. However, despite their differences they work together breaking all the rules to hunt the killer before he strikes again. Mark McManus and Neil Duncan star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a political activist 15 years earlier but, just as it is getting somewhere, Ted orders the investigation to be halted and Ucos is threatened with closure following its perceived mishandling of the Hanway case. However, the team refuses to give up, and finds evidence of a cover-up involving top officials and a multi-national drugs company. Guest starring Meera Syal and Lorraine Ashbourne.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: A worrying event back home involving his wife forces Michael Stubbs contemplate his priorities. Starring Robson Green and Rob Spendlove.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Terry is beside himself with worry about his nephews' safety, convinced they are being abused by his brother, and jeopardises the case to help them. Meadows attends the funeral of former colleague Ted Roach, and is drawn into investigating the suspicious circumstances surrounding his death, helped by ex-coppers Bob Cryer and Alec Peters. Questioning his own mortality in the process, he wonders whether a quieter pace of life would suit him better, but soon realises he would miss the thrill of the job and sets off home in a more positive mood - until he gets a shooting pain down his arm.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Zubin's barely controlled jealousy leaves Jess wondering if she has made a mistake, so she decides to end her relationship with Reza. Connie is determined to show Will who's in charge, and dispatches him to a teaching course. However, Ric is concerned that her continued persecution will force him to quit. Tricia thinks Carlos wants to break up with her, but he has a surprise in store that convinces her otherwise.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Toxic fumes are released into the atmosphere when chemical additives accidentally spill while being delivered to a swimming pool, while a violent drug addict causes havoc inside an ambulance. Gloria's former lover and current landlord evicts her, and Richard experiences problems with blurred vision.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Neil speedily steps into a convalescing Jack Meadows' shoes, much to the dismay of Debbie McAllister, who takes a dim view of his unseemly haste to take over. Rob organises a disastrous raid on the Radfords' club, while Samantha receives a video of missing daughter Abi, belatedly bringing Phil Hunter round to the view that the youngster has been kidnapped.

programme.title: Pride and Prejudice
programme.desc: Andrew Davies' adaptation of Jane Austen's classic novel, starring Colin Firth, Jennifer Ehle, Alison Steadman, Benjamin Whitrow and Julia Sawalha. A wealthy eligible bachelor rents a property in Hertfordshire, causing a flurry of anticipation among the ladies of the district. However, it transpires he also brought along a friend - the haughty and aloof Fitzwilliam Darcy.

programme.title: Pride and Prejudice
programme.desc: Mrs Bennet spots an opportunity to marry off another of her daughters with the arrival of clergyman Mr Collins. However, Elizabeth is unable to take his proposal seriously, being too preoccupied with a handsome newcomer who poisons her mind further against Mr Darcy. Alison Steadman, Jennifer Ehle and David Bamber star in Andrew Davies' adaptation of Jane Austen's classic novel.

programme.title: Pride and Prejudice
programme.desc: Elizabeth visits Mr Collins once Charlotte has accepted his proposal of marriage and confides in Jane that she regards him as one of the stupidest men in England. Mrs Bennet sizes up George Wickham as a potential suitor for her daughter - but he has set his heart on society heiress Miss King.

programme.title: Pride and Prejudice
programme.desc: Rejected by Elizabeth, Darcy decides to return to Rosling Park - and resolves to reveal the truth about Wickham's character in a letter. Colin Firth, Jennifer Ehle, Alison Steadman, Benjamin Whitrow and Julia Sawalha star.

programme.title: Pride and Prejudice
programme.desc: Despite Miss Bingley's efforts to keep them apart, Darcy and Elizabeth's relationship grows more affectionate - until bad news arrives from Longbourn about Lydia and Wickham. Jane Austen adaptation, starring Jennifer Ehle, Colin Firth and Julia Sawalha.

programme.title: Pride and Prejudice
programme.desc: Wickham's elopement with Lydia makes Elizabeth see him for what he really is, while Bingley proposes to Jane - an offer she readily accepts. Colin Firth and Jennifer Ehle star.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest investigates when a body is found at the stone circle in a polio-stricken village, leading him to conclude that dark forces are involved - and another sacrifice could be imminent. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: The president of the local cricket club is found shot dead in the middle of the pitch after a recent victory. Suspicion falls on his family and fellow players, but all of them have an alibi. JP thinks Dwayne is keeping something from him and wonders how well he knows his friend, and Humphrey dreads Martha's imminent departure from the island.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team looks into the death of a terrorist 30 years previously after his daughter receives an anonymous note claiming he was murdered - an investigation that takes them right back to the Greenham Common anti-nuclear protests. Meanwhile, Sasha agrees to go for dinner with her ex-husband Ned, which he is hoping will lead to a reconciliation. Tamzin Outhwaite and Dennis Waterman star, with guest appearances from Barnaby Kay, Charlotte Cornwell and Patricia Potter.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Jim and the team investigate when a dismembered body is found under the floorboards of a Glasgow house. Things take a turn for the worse when the victim's nine-month-old baby is kidnapped from a multi-storey car park. Drama, starring Mark McManus, Neil Duncan, Harriet Buchan and Robert Robertson.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Beatrice contemplates expanding the business, while an unexpected offer from one of Jack's old flames has bittersweet consequences. Starring Stella Gonet.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Tired of being undermined by Florence, Tilly resigns as head seamstress. Meanwhile, Evie spends a weekend working for the wealthy Duglass family - but finds herself caught in the middle of a feud. Period drama, starring Stella Gonet and Louise Lombard.

programme.title: Britain's Top 100 Dogs: 2019
programme.desc: Ben Fogle and Sara Cox count down the nation's favourite dog breeds, with the top 10 decided by a public vote. The programme features fascinating facts about the heritage, key characteristics and personality traits of every breed in the top 100 chart, as well as a host of famous faces - including Harry Redknapp, Penny Lancaster, Gemma Atkinson and Martin and Shirley Kemp - sharing stories about their bond with their four-legged friends. There are also funny and heartwarming dog-related stories from across the country.

programme.title: Who's Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: TV singers and vocal coaches Carrie and David Grant are today's VIP cooks, providing the food for Team Uniform - comprising a policeman, a vicar, a fireman and a midwife - who have to guess their identities with the help of a few cryptic clues. If the guests are successful, they will be one step closer to winning the full cash prize - but if they fail, they will be the ones doing the washing up. Hosted by Brian McFadden.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen

programme.title: Ainsley's Caribbean Kitchen
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott takes a culinary tour of the Caribbean, visiting the islands that have inspired his cooking. His first stop is Jamaica, where his father grew up. He visits the island's famous Coronation Market and a Rastafarian farm-to-table restaurant, where he learns to make ackee-stuffed ravioli. He also takes a trip to the villa where Ian Fleming created James Bond.

programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Dare Master

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.desc: Bubbles, Blossom and Buttercup fly into action once more.

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: The teenage superheroes fight to save the world while getting up to mischievous antics.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Fuzzypeg eats the Spuds' fish supper and Dave has to catch another. Things look up when he hooks something, but it turns out to be a whale..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: George takes Dave on an adventure camping, but Dave isn't sure it's a great idea. He's proved right when they both wake up in a bear's cave..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: George takes the Spuds to the museum of mouldy cheese. Anna dares Dave to lick the cheeses on display, and Dave's bad breath wakes one of the exhibits up.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Betty wants a nice photo of Dave and Anna, but the camera George uses happens to belong to Gran, and it's been cursed by an ancient mummy..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz beams himself into Weasel's brain in order to take out Magoo with tranquilliser darts. Magoo loses Mr Cat and enlists his neighbour to find him..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo thinks he's in a triathlon and takes Fizz's superhuman strength headband, which Fizz needs to beat the President at a thumb war.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Today's the big day, and Magoo believes he is in a recording studio to make a hit single for famous producer, Phil Dustspeck. But is that really true?.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Spurred into action by the discovery of a woman's body in Midsomer Worthy's Raven's Wood, Barnaby and Troy re-examine three similar unsolved murders in the same village nine years previously, hoping to get a lead before the killer strikes again. As they dig deeper into the clandestine world of the community, they find themselves embroiled in a sinister web of deceit, violence and mystery. Guest starring Toby Jones and Phyllis Logan.

programme.title: You've Been Framed!
programme.desc: Harry Hill revisits some of the nation's favourite funniest videos, using his unique narration to turn viewers' slapstick into celebrity satire - but who will earn a place in the hall of fame?.

programme.title: ITV Racing Live
programme.sub-title: Racing on STV: Live from Kempton
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of the 3.05 Ladbrokes King George VI Steeple Chase from Kempton Park, which follows races at 1.20, 1.55 and 2.30. Plus, a race from 2.10 at Wetherby. With analysis from Ruby Walsh and AP McCoy, reports by Mick Fitzgerald, Luke Harvey, Matt Chapman and Sally Ann Grassick, and commentary from Richard Hoiles.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Compilation of some of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, in which the last contestant standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Tenable All Stars
programme.desc: Warwick Davis presents a Christmas-themed version of the Top 10 general knowledge quiz. Joining him are a star-studded team of panto celebrities - Debbie McGee, Louie Spence, Paul Chuckle, Rustie Lee and Paul Zerdin - who'll be taking on the Tenable Tower for the chance to win 125,000 for their chosen charities.

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a festive special of the game show from Manchester, where he sets members of the public unusual Christmas-themed challenges and unwraps a variety of hilarious games.

programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.sub-title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs at Christmas
programme.desc: The comedian helps out at Battersea Dogs & Cats Home over the festive period, where he is enlisted to help pooches with behavioural problems. They include a reclusive mongrel that refuses to leave its kennel and a grumpy Yorkshire terrier that refuses to walk. Paul also helps an overprotective staffie mum struggling to say goodbye to her pups and an excitable one-year-old puppy that just cannot stop having little accidents. He also gets out and about with the street vets to bring festive joy to London's homeless and their dogs.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Graham pleads his case to Rhona, David is determined to keep things quiet, and Nicola reaches out to Laurel.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Following one of the most dramatic Christmas Days in Weatherfield history, the long-suffering Street residents come to terms with the aftermath and try to get their lives back in order.

programme.title: Skyfall (2012)
programme.desc: James Bond pursues a mysterious criminal mastermind who has orchestrated a terrorist attack on MI6 headquarters and exposed the identities of undercover agents around the world. The trail leads to a rogue former operative who has a personal vendetta against the intelligence organisation's leader M - who is also facing calls to retire. Sam Mendes directs the 23rd instalment in the spy franchise, starring Daniel Craig as 007, with Javier Bardem, Judi Dench, Ralph Fiennes, Naomie Harris and Ben Whishaw.

programme.title: The Jonathan Ross Show
programme.desc: The host welcomes another batch of celebrity guests to his famous green room for a special Christmas edition of the talk show. He is joined by David Tennant, whose demonic role in Terry Pratchett and Neil Gaiman's Good Omens will be coming to BBC in the new year, as well as singers Rita Ora and Jamie Cullum, former X Factor judge Sharon Osbourne, Strictly Come Dancing: It Takes Two presenter Rylan Clark-Neal, award-winning Hollywood star David Oyelowo and comedian Bec Hill.

programme.title: Who's Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: The contestants are guaranteed some fine food today as their mystery host is celebrity chef Aldo Zilli. Can he cook up enough cryptic clues to hide his Italian identity or will he be getting out the Fairy Liquid when the diners have all gone home? Brian McFadden plays go-between.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Ainsley's Caribbean Kitchen
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott continues his tour of Jamaica, taking a trip into the Blue Mountains to learn the secrets of the region's famous coffee. He also visits one of the island's most acclaimed jerk chicken establishments and tries to get his hands on their secret recipe, before whipping up a mango and pineapple milkshake at famous hotel Jamaica Inn.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A house-hunting couple are found dead shortly after viewing a supposedly haunted cottage. Locals claim the property is cursed - but Barnaby and Jones soon hear enough to suspect several builders, developers and estate agents of resorting to murder. John Nettles and Jason Hughes star, with George Baker, Ruth Gemmell and Jane Wymark.

programme.title: The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor (2008)
programme.desc: Daredevil explorers Rick and Evelyn O'Connell are called into action when their son accidentally resurrects the evil Chinese Emperor Han from his ancient tomb. The family now faces a race against time to prevent the merciless leader from awakening his vast terracotta army in a plot to take over the world. Fantasy adventure sequel, starring Brendan Fraser, Maria Bello, Jet Li and Michelle Yeoh.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Jack Frost (1998)
programme.desc: A rock musician who realises he is spending too much time away from his family is killed in a car accident while travelling home for the festive season. The following year his spirit takes on the form of a snowman, made by his son, allowing them to spend one last Christmas together. Fantasy drama, starring Michael Keaton, Kelly Preston, Joseph Cross and Mark Addy.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which a team of five wheelchair basketball enthusiasts answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts a special seasonal edition of the quiz, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine in the hope of winning 20,000 for charity. Donning panto outfits to get into the festive spirit - oh yes they do - Lesley Joseph, Vicky Pattison and Christopher Biggins all bid to land their charities a Christmas gift to remember.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Coronation Street stars Simon Gregson, Victoria Ekanoye, Lucy Fallon and Andrew Whyment pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Kim tries to get Jamie on side, Rhona worries what people might think, and David's anxiety grows.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Michelle heads to the bistro to hand over the keys to the new owner, but when the mystery buyer turns out to be Ray, she sets about smashing up the place. Elsewhere, Ali reveals that he's told the police about Gary's secret life as a loan shark, and a mortified Fiz confesses to Tyrone and Jade how she bought a gun for the shop, and it was then stolen.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: It's a time of joy and happiness in Midsomer for once - Christmas is coming, and DCI Barnaby and his wife Sarah are soon to become parents. But the festive mood changes when a man is stabbed to death with an antique sword during a ghost-hunting party at a spooky manor house in Morton Shallows. Is blacksmith's daughter Rose Wilton seeking revenge from beyond the grave, or will Barnaby and sidekick Charlie Nelson find a more earthly motive behind the murder? Starring Neil Dudgeon and Gwilym Lee, with Fiona Dolman, Les Dennis, Elizabeth Berrington, Mark Heap, Emily Joyce, James Murray and Hannah Tointon.

programme.title: Love Actually (2003)
programme.desc: Ten interlinked stories of people searching for and finding love. While the newly elected, bachelor British prime minister is smitten by a junior staff member at 10 Downing Street, a heartbroken writer heads for France to get over a failed relationship, and a faded rock star aims to reinvent himself in time for Christmas. Richard Curtis's romantic comedy, with Hugh Grant, Martine McCutcheon, Emma Thompson, Alan Rickman, Colin Firth, Bill Nighy and Liam Neeson.

programme.title: Meet the Parents
programme.desc: Dating show, hosted by Holly Willoughby, which puts the love lives of singletons in the hands of the people they know best - their mum and dad. Each week, one man and one woman must choose from three potential partners, with their decisions solely based on an encounter with the contestants' parents.

programme.title: Who's Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: TV presenter Charlotte Hawkins puts on a dinner party for four strangers, who have to work out the identity of their mystery celebrity host with the help of a few cryptic clues - otherwise they will be doing the washing up. Hosted by Brian McFadden.

programme.desc: Dave gets a girlfriend who turns out to be an alien. And she turns out to bear a striking similarity to an everyday household item..

programme.title: The Sara Cox Show
programme.sub-title: The Sara Cox Show at Christmas
programme.desc: The presenter is joined by comedians Jason Manford, Frank Skinner and Suzi Ruffell, and there is live music from Gabrielle Aplin and Hannah Grace.

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.sub-title: James Martin's Saturday Morning at Christmas
programme.desc: James is joined by Olympic gold medallist and Celebrity MasterChef winner Greg Rutherford, along with chefs Francesco Mazzei and John Williams, and cocktail guru Merlin Griffiths.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John and Lisa cook up some family festive favourites, including glazed ham, a baked Tunworth cheese with onions and potatoes, and mini turkey and ham pies. Plus, Lisa decorates the tree with some beautiful Christmas biscuits.

programme.title: Nadia's Family Feasts
programme.desc: Nadia Sawalha and Alex Hollywood help to prepare a festive family feast, including Nadia's annual tradition of hot sausage and cheddar rolls for breakfast, ginger gammon with tartiflette for lunch, a recipe for the ultimate turkey dinner, and Alex's delicious alternative to dessert with a white chocolate, raspberry and cranberry brioche for pudding.

programme.title: Beautiful Baking with Juliet Sear
programme.desc: Juliet conjures up some ideas for Christmas, including baked party canapes, a brussels sprouts tarte tatin and a spectacular chocolate orange profiteroles tower. Liam Charles pays a visit to serve up Christmas lunch on a sheet of ruff puff pastry and Juliet visits chef Chantelle Nicholson in her London restaurant to sample a vegan main course Christmas meal.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Travellers descend on the sleepy village of Martyr Warren, antagonising local magistrate Hector Bridges, whose subsequent death by shooting brings matters to a head in dramatic fashion. Barnaby and Troy's investigation uncovers the victim has a history with one of the travellers - but revelations that he terrorised his family suggest that the killer may be closer to home.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: One of the most enjoyable things for viewers of The Chase is watching Bradley Walsh collapse in a fit of giggles after pronouncing a question wrong, or when a rude-sounding name crops up - or taking a contestant to one side to give them a telling-off if they get too big for their boots. Here, the host presents a second selection of these and other such unscripted moments and out-takes from the teatime quiz show.

programme.title: Guardians of the Galaxy Vol 2 (2017)
programme.desc: After saving Xandar from Ronan's wrath, intergalactic outlaws Peter Quill (AKA Star-Lord), Gamora, Drax the Destroyer, Groot and Rocket Raccoon are recognised as heroes. Now, they must fight to stay together as they unravel the mystery surrounding Ego, a man who claims to be Quill's father. Writer/director James Gunn's follow up to his 2014 blockbuster, which reunites Chris Pratt, Zoe Saldana, Karen Gillan and Dave Bautista, with support from Kurt Russell, Sylvester Stallone and Pom Klementieff. Bradley Cooper also provides the voice of Rocket and Vin Diesel is Groot.

programme.title: Cape Fear (1991)
programme.desc: A psychopathic rapist is released from prison after 14 years and plots revenge on the defence attorney he blames for his imprisonment. Subjecting the lawyer and his family to a terrifying campaign of intimidation, he uses his knowledge of the law to stay untouchable. Martin Scorsese's thriller remake, starring Robert De Niro, Nick Nolte, Jessica Lange and Juliette Lewis, with cameo appearances by Gregory Peck, Robert Mitchum and Martin Balsam, who all appeared in the 1962 original.

programme.title: Animal Mums
programme.desc: How young animals copy their mother to learn new skills that are vital to keep them a live in the wild, including cheetah cubs learning how to hunt, with Liesl Eichenberger of the Sanbona Reserve in South Africa explaining the different stages of hunt school. Gorilla researcher Eva Maria Luef reveals the different gestures used to beg for food from their mother and initiate play, while Ellen Jackson at a stud farm in Sacramento talks about the close bond between horse foals and their mother, and how they learn to socialise and run with the herd. Narrated by Hugh Bonneville.

Also appearing here is TV personality Michael Barrymore, although a broken wrist suffered after the recording of this programme has ruled him out of the main show, and he is replaced by former Blue Peter host Radzi Chinyanganya. In this first edition, the celebrities are paired up with their professional partners, while Torvill and Dean also perform a spectacular routine with some special guests, before taking to the judges' desk alongside Ashley Banjo and newcomer John Barrowman.

Paul also helps an overprotective staffie mum struggling to say goodbye to her pups and an excitable one-year-old puppy that just cannot stop having little accidents.
